item.title: Samantha add a quote by Frank McCourt
item.description: "When I look back on my childhood I wonder how I survived at all. It was, of course, a miserable childhood: the happy childhood is hardly worth your while. Worse than the ordinary miserable childhood is the miserable Irish childhood, and worse yet is the miserable Irish Catholic childhood. . . . nothing can compare with the Irish version: the poverty; the shiftless loquacious alcoholic father; the pious defeated mother moaning by the fire; pompous priests; bullying schoolmasters; the English and the terrible things they did to us for eight hundred long years." -- Frank McCourt

item.title: Samantha add a quote by Daniel Patrick Moynihan
item.description: "To be Irish is to know that in the end the world will break your heart." -- Daniel Patrick Moynihan

item.title: Samantha add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "A poem begins as a lump in the throat, a sense of wrong, a homesickness, a lovesickness." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Samantha add a quote by Wally Lamb
item.description: "This was what could happen to you: you could end up this far from where you thought you were going." -- Wally Lamb
